item.title: The Python Tutorial Notes - Chapter 12
item.description: Modified: July 19 2024 Virtual Environments and Packages 12.1 Introduction Often, you’re going to need tools and modules that aren’t included with Python by default, or in your standard library. One Python install might not suffice for most applications. To circumnavigate this, we create virtual environments, that act as self-contained directories with an installation of Python, and any number of packages. 12.2 Creating Virtual Environments We can use the venv module to create and manage our own virtual environment.
